'Xylella fastidiosa', a bacterium in the class Gammaproteobacteria, is an
important plant pathogen that causes 'phoney peach disease' in the southern
United States, Bacterial Leaf Scorch, 'oleander leaf scorch', and 'Pierce's
disease', and 'citrus variegated chlorosis disease' (CVC) in Brazil.
